description: ..without unnecessary functions
muy buena aplicación, como el titulo de esta review, es simple y va directo a lo que es, escuchar podcast y no tiene opciones engorsas
Works perfectly. no issues. has all of my niche podcasts on it.

This app has went from being 'okay' to being, and I quote my wife; 

"Better than any podcasting app I have on my phone" 

(she has a random android device).

I'm really happy with the integrated search and downloading functions, and the fact that buttons are actually colored, making the gui more interesting to look at than many gtk apps.
I love to use this app to listen my favorite episodes. And now I can enjoy without downloading. And there's a delete button too. I like it. I really want to know the like of the 1.0 version.

Simple, fast, lightweight and (until now) works seamlessy!
Have fast play, autodeletion of older episodes, and simply does the job! \o/
summary: The best desktop podcast client app ever made!

description: Works great! Option to import podcast subscriptions from iTunes was nice. Fast and lightweight. Also nice that the audio plays from within the app rather than opening an external player. Recommended!
Every app doesn't need 1000 features!  Love it as -is!
summary: Simple, easy to use, just great

description: Can import entire OPML files from other clients to get a huge database, but cannot even delete a single episode.
Way too basic, you might as well just use rhythmbox.
summary: Can't even display the full title, nevermind summaries and show notes

description: I like it better than Rhythmbox. Build in speed of playback and marked all as played etc is nice. My biggest beef with both apps is it does not remember playback position on quit. I play a lot of long form podcast and hunting and pecking to find where I left off is annoying.

Fast podcast app which covers the basics whilst following the GNOME HIG and generally looking beautiful. Future versions look to be even better with the nightly build adding support for things like MPRIS for deeper desktop integration
summary: Best Podcast client for the GNOME platform

description: Doesn't adhere to GTK theme installed like other apps, built-in dark theme doesn't work either.
GNOME Podcasts meets all my needs, and does it in a simple, beautiful way. I can't think of a single issue I've had with it.

Doesn't download new episodes. Gets stuck on retrieving new episodes but doesn't do anything after that. Going back and forth between shows sometimes makes the episode list not appear. Went back to Rhythmbox, which works just fine, and includes podcast search.
summary: Wanted to like it, but it doesn't work

description: It doesn't seem to ask for user/password for paid or private podcasts and you can't specify it in the URL either. Moreover, the "import" function hangs.
Clean and functional, love it!

I like the simplistic approach and basic playback works, but it needs some updates. I'd start with syncing with Gpodder to help mobile users use apps like AntennaPod to have their library across platforms.

* No view for only downloaded Episodes
* No information on the current Episode (Shownotes?!)
* No easy way to subscribe to new Podcasts from the App

BUT otherwise one of the cleanest and best Podcast Apps I used. Continue working on it and this will become a great piece of software.
summary: Good Player but still lacking features

description: does not work for me
Use Acast on NAdroid, this is very simple compare to Acast but work OK

Clean and simple and this is all we need!
Thanks!

I love how clean and easy to use Podcasts app is; I love that it's written in Rust, and I plan to contribute to it. As for the app itself I would give it 4/5 stars.

But Flatpak package is broken; every second day the Podcasts app crashes on start because of some broken Flatpak dependency. There's no UI indication of what happened (I need to run it in terminal to see that problem is caused by "Error initializing gtk").

App itself: 5 stars. Flatpak: 1 star.

I hope it will be packaged in rpm soon.
summary: App with a great potential broken by Flatpak

description: You have to download the whole episode before listening, which is inconvenient for long episodes with large filesizes. The app works great otherwise.

Nice looking and light app. However, it would be much better with these added features:
* Ability to search for podcasts within the app. It's really clunk to open another app (e.g. Audacity) to find podcasts first and get the URL. 
* Ability to stream podcasts without having to download first!
* Ability to see podcast episode descriptions within the app

Would recommend developers take a look at Apple Podcasts or Cumulonimbus and take copious notes...
summary: Looks nice, features a work in progress

description: I can not remove the downloaded podcast episodes :/

First a foremost, if you can get past the GUI, it's a good app. However, I can't get past the GUI, especially when it markets itself for Gnome. Gnome decorations are not supported and the window has an integrated top-bar with minimise and maximise buttons. Sort of like a wanna-be apple application.

I would remove Gnome from the application name and put apple instead.
No podcast discovery, no podcast search, no streaming(just download), no show notes, no episode deletion. But hey, sleek(ish) UI.
You have to download all episodes manually? No, thanks.
Sad to see that this podcast app is missing everything you would want to have a podcast app for - no queue, no auto download, no episode info....

I can't say I don't love this podcast player but still I don't think it has sufficient feature to replace the apps you find on Android. The positive side is that the interface is clear and nice and it's pretty fast.
summary: A bit feature lacking bust nice and fast

description: Might be good but I didn't test further once I saw I cannot set a custom download path.
Great application!
it doesnt stream!!!
Good and simple app

Amazing Simple & Easy to Use App to Play Your Podcasts!

Has changed the way I consume digital media : )
summary: Amazing Simple & Easy to Use App to Play Your Podcasts!

description: misses the point. Not very usable at all.

It could use a more obvious way of unsubscribing from the podcast, like a red button on the podcast page. Also, being able to search in popular catalogues (Apple Podcasts, Google Podcasts, whatever else) would be great.
Manually entering RSS feeds is not ideal. It is 2021 guys, come on.
summary: I'd like to ask for a search function

description: Give it a feed URL, download & listen. Dead simple and I like it. Needs the ability to mark individual episodes as listened without downloading. Otherwise what more do you need?

I imported some podcasts from my phone which works nicely via an opml file. But unfortunately it hangs and then remains silent on several episodes which renders it unusable for me. It also doesn't allow for downloading, doesn't remember playback position. The app looks nice but is a little limited in its use. I'd love to see the work continued.
The audio stops working. Also doesn't seem to remember where you left off if you close the app. This is more or less broken.

The fact that this doesn't support search in, say, the itunes store or podcastindex.org is bad enough, but bearable: I'll add my podcasts once manually or import a file and be done with it. 

The fact that a podcast app forces you to download a whole podcast episode before listening to it because it is unable to stream it is just amateurish. The fact that it doesn't show you the description of the podcast episode or anything beyond the title is inexplicable. The fact that it doesn't keep track of the episodes you have listened to is simply lazy. 

But in particular, the fact that there is no built-in way inside the app to delete the podcasts you've downloaded is straight-up user hostile.

To whomever spent three minutes of their life coding this app and to whomever greenlit it to be the default gnome podcast app I only want to ask one thing: are you sure you know what a podcast is?
summary: Amateurish, no better than just listening to pocasts on your browser

description: No-nonsense and easy to use if all you want is to import a feed and play back media. This is not the app for you if you're expecting much more than that, though!
summary: Does what it needs to do and no more

description: Simple, easy way to listen to podcasts.
Simple and easy to use on my Pinephone.
This works great and has a very simplistic feel to the UI making easy to use.

I love it for the podcast channels I imported from a service. And it's good to listen to those and update those within this application, UI is clean, app is not bloated. Sweet. Just one feature is needed: to discover new podcasts and add them from within the application without the need of adding RSS links or import files. Like with other modern podcast applications.
It gives you podcasts but lacks essential features like gpoddr sync and extended shownotes.

for those who want to play a podcast from an app, very limited managebiity of podcast and biggest problem is downloaded episode can't even be located so you can manual transfer say to a actual ipod or portable mp3 player.

works well at checking for new episodes and playing episodes without using lots of processor. Would be nice if it advanced to next episode or queue, and had some manual management of files or stream option.
Yes you can for a dark theme to it, but for a Gnome circle app it's just shameful.

The app doesn't allow you to control the very basics of your reproduction, like adding more episodes to a queue. If you use this to listen to long form podcasts this is OK, but if you listen to daylies (15 minutes or less), this is not an option as you will be having to lose focus on your work to choose the next episode to play.

Also: doesn't react to light / dark settings in modern gnome.

With *just the queue* this would be a clear 4 star, with playlists a 5.
add a feed with few hundred elements and the 'New' tab will freeze/slow the app due to loading of the elements. optimize it

Instead of a GTK4 port it should have more features developed.
It lacks automatic download of podcasts as well as it cannot play video podcasts.

What this application desperately needs is filtering and sorting episode lists, playlists, and continuous play. At the moment it's ok if you don't mind having to scroll to the bottom and find the last episode you played so you can pick up where you left off. The fact that you can't even reverse the sort order to put oldest episodes at the top is a real dealbreaker.
Very nice looking app. Only question I have is where the downloads are stored and how to delete the files after listening.
Simpe and good app
If your goal is to be a decent podcast app, ypu need a search function, for the love of Hell.

I enjoy this simple app to listen to podcasts. I imported my subscriptions feed file and away it went filling my list. My only grip with this app is how to remove downloads. Supposedly it magically gets deleted but I can't find the path to even make sure on my flatpak app in Fedora.
summary: Simple app but maybe too simple

description:
The application stores downloaded episodes in a hidden directory and non-descriptive filenames like "1.unknown". No preferences or settings to change that location. Had to use System Monitor to locate my downloaded episodes. Pretty useless if you want to copy or sync episodes to a playback device (a basic and common scenario), or just maintain some general overview and control over the stuff on your computer.

Why not store them in something like $HOME/Podcasts/Podcast/Episode.mp3 or something?
this is the bees knees in podcast software

Jetzt, da man Podcasts suchen kann und nicht mehr per RSS hinzufügen muss ist es mein Podcast Player der Wahl!
Passt sich wunderbar in Gnome ein und hat alle Features, die ich brauche.
Das einzige, was noch schön wäre, ist die implementierung von GPodder. Aber das Protokoll ist ja sowieso sehr basic, sodass das nicht mehr als nice-to-have wäre.

There should be known podcasts available by default. It's just crazy to ship an app without any features, where you have to search only for what you want to hear. Right now the app is completely useless as a podcast app for starters.
Sehr einfach gehaltener Player. Podcasts müssen manuell per URL hinzugefügt werden. Es besteht die Möglichkeit die Wiedergabegeschwindigkeit zu verändern.

It's a very nice app, with which you can comfortable listen to podcasts.
You will need to find the RSS feeds of the podcasts yourself, but with websites like "podcastaddict.com" it's not a problem!
P.s. if you insert the wrong link or mistype, it might take for a long time to load so be careful!
Keine Möglichkeit auch ältere Episoden zu laden, somit absolut nutzlos. Schöne Oberfläche aber viel zu vereinfacht. Für Liebhaber von älteren Episoden absoluter Unfug.
Podrías poner un buscador de podcast en el boton de +, si no es imposible
Solo he tenido que copiar el enlace XML en el navegador, darle al + en el programa, pegar dicho enlace y ya tengo todo para reproducir.
Buena app, estable, pero le hace falta un buscador. Para agregar un podcast debes primero buscarlo en alguna página como ivoox, desde ahí copias el enlace RSS y lo pegas después en la app.
summary: Buena, pero le falta un buscador

description:
Falta poder eliminar capitulos descargados, un buscador...la aplicacion esta bien...pero gpoder, siendo igual de sencilla, le da mil vueltas. 
La sencillez de uso no puede conseguirse a base de quitar opciones esenciales.

Me encanta el trabajo minimalista que han realizado y la belleza y sencillez de la aplicación.  Otro punto muy positivo es la forma de actualizar los episodios nuevos por la fecha de hoy, ayer, esta semana. Poder ver los detalles de los programas excelente también espero que lo que esta bién en mi opinión no cambie.

Sin embargo debo puntualizar que hace mucha falta en un programa de podcast poder poder reproducir por streaming los epizodios y poder descargar los que queremos conservar y por supuesto poder exportar a otras unidades los que hemos descargados. Por favor necesitamos la opción de crear un playlist de nuestros podcast. Por último necesitamos un buen buscador de podcasts más facil e intuitivo.

Quisiera tener la esperanza de que estos comentarios puedan aportar al desarrollo de esta maravillosa aplicación. particularemente es de mi uso frecuente, gracias por darme la oportunidad de opinar.
J'ai essayé un grand nombre d'applications de podcast, et je fini toujours par revenir sur celle-ci, qui est la plus simple tout en étant la plus efficace à l'usage. Bravo aux développeurs !

Application plus simple et pourtant plus aboutie que Vocals, proposée sur ElementaryOS, qui elle n'est pas exempt de bugs en tous genre. L'intégration d'une page "découverte" serait un sacré plus. L'application supporte MPRIS et s'intègre donc très bien aux différents environnement de bureaux (KDE Plasma user here)
aucun soucis sous fedora 34
Doesn't play on Raspberry Pi 400 running Ubuntu 22.04.

Sur KDE Plasma, j'utilisais Kasts, que je préfère encore, surout à cause de la fonctionnalité de recherche de podcasts intégrée, au lieu d'aller chercher des flux rss manuellement.
Néanmoins j'apprécie la simplicité de cette application.
Il serait agréable d'avoir un mode sombre.
Il serait bien de ne pas avoir à télécharger les podcasts avant de pouvoir les jour (ou simplement avoir un bouton "play" qui télécharge automatiquement l'épisode avant de le jouer
Marcher mal....
а где гайд по тому как эта штука работает? каналы с ютуба и рутуба по урл ссылке не добавляются.
summary: нифига непонятно как эта штука работает

description: Работает не с всеми сервисами, но Apple Podcasts работает прекрасно. Пробуйте и тестируйте =)
